API Documentation¶

Full API documentation of the Leaspy Python package.

leaspy.api: Main API¶

The main class, from which you can instantiate and calibrate a model, personalize it to a given set a subjects, estimate trajectories and simulate synthetic data.

Leaspy(model_name, **kwargs)

Main API used to fit models, run algorithms and simulations.

leaspy.algo: Algorithms¶

Contains all algorithms used in the package.

abstract_algo.AbstractAlgo()

Abstract class containing common methods for all algorithm classes.

algo_factory.AlgoFactory()

Return the wanted algorithm given its name.

leaspy.algo.fit: Fit algorithms¶

Algorithms used to calibrate a model.

abstract_fit_algo.AbstractFitAlgo()

Abstract class containing common method for all fit algorithm classes.

abstract_mcmc.AbstractFitMCMC(settings)

Abstract class containing common method for all fit algorithm classes based on Monte-Carlo Markov Chains (MCMC).

tensor_mcmcsaem.TensorMCMCSAEM(settings)

Main algorithm for MCMC-SAEM.

leaspy.algo.fit: Personalization algorithms¶

Algorithms used to personalize a model to a given set of subjects.

abstract_personalize_algo.AbstractPersonalizeAlgo(…)

Abstract class for personalize algorithm.

scipy_minimize.ScipyMinimize(settings)

Gradient descent based algorithm to compute individual parameters, i.e. personalize a model to a given set of subjects.

leaspy.algo.fit: Samplers¶

Samplers used by the algorithms.

abstract_sampler.AbstractSampler(info, …)

Abstract sampler class.

gibbs_sampler.GibbsSampler(info, n_patients)

Gibbs sampler class.

hmc_sampler.HMCSampler(info, n_patients, eps)

Hamiltonian Monte Carlo sampler class.

leaspy.algo.fit: Simulation algorithms¶

Algorithm to simulate synthetic observations and individual parameters.

simulate.SimulationAlgorithm(settings)

To simulate new data given existing one by learning the individual parameters joined distribution.

leaspy.dataset: Datasets¶

Give access to some synthetic longitudinal observations mimicking cohort of subjects with neurodegenerative disorders, as well as calibrated models and computed individual parameters.

loader.Loader()

Contains static methods to load synthetic longitudinal dataset, calibrated Leaspy instances & IndividualParameters.

leaspy.io: Inputs / Outputs¶

Containers class objects used as input / ouputs in the Leaspy package.

leaspy.io.data: Data containers¶

csv_data_reader.CSVDataReader(path)

Methods to convert csv files to data containers Leaspy compliants.

data.Data()

Main data container, initialized from a csv file or a pandas.DataFrame.

dataframe_data_reader.DataframeDataReader(df)

Methods to convert pandas.DataFrame to data containers Leaspy compliants.

dataset.Dataset(data[, model, algo])

Data container based on pytorch Tensors, used to run algorithms.

individual_data.IndividualData(idx)

Data container for individual parameters, used to contruct a Data container.

leaspy.io.outputs: Outputs class objects¶

individual_parameters.IndividualParameters()

Data container for individual parameters, contains IDs, timepoints and observations values.

leaspy.io.outputs: Realizations class objects¶

collection_realization.CollectionRealization()

Realizations of population and individual parameters.

realization.Realization(name, shape, …)

Contains the realization of a given parameter.

leaspy.io.settings: Settings class objects¶

algorithm_settings.AlgorithmSettings(name, …)

Used to set the algorithms’ settings.

model_settings.ModelSettings(…)

Used in leaspy.api.Leaspy.load to create a Leaspy class object from a json file.

outputs_settings.OutputsSettings(settings)

Used to create the logs folder to monitor the convergence of the calibration algorithm.

leaspy.models: Models¶

Available models in Leaspy.

abstract_model.AbstractModel(name)

Contains the common attributes & methods of the different models.

abstract_multivariate_model.AbstractMultivariateModel(…)

Contains the common attributes & methods of the multivariate models.

model_factory.ModelFactory()

Return the wanted model given its name.

multivariate_model.MultivariateModel(name, …)

Logistic model for multiple variables of interest.

multivariate_parallel_model.MultivariateParallelModel(…)

Logistic model for multiple variables of interest, imposing same average evolution pace for all variables.

univariate_model.UnivariateModel(name, **kwargs)

Logistic model for a single variable of interest.

leaspy.models.utils.attributes: Models’ attributes¶

Attributes used by the models.

attributes_abstract.AttributesAbstract([…])

Contains the common attributes & methods of the different attributes classes.

attributes_factory.AttributesFactory()

Return an Attributes class object based on the given parameters.

attributes_linear.AttributesLinear(…)

Contains the common attributes & methods to update the linear model’s attributes.

attributes_logistic.AttributesLogistic(…)

Contains the common attributes & methods to update the logistic model’s attributes.

attributes_logistic_parallel.AttributesLogisticParallel(…)

Contains the common attributes & methods of the logistic parallel models’ attributes.

attributes_univariate.AttributesUnivariate()

Contains the common attributes & methods to update the univariate model’s attributes.

leaspy.models.utils.model_initialization: Initialization methods¶
